title: Why didn’t BTS get nominated for the 2020 Grammys? - Quora

response.answer_text: Their fans will likely be mad about this answer… but I don’t think it had as much to do with race and culture as people think, although I’m sure it played a role, but there are other factors I believe. BTS entered into categories against primarily Western artists that top the charts here. That was part of the problem. BTS against Ariana Grande or Taylor Swift or H.E.R. for a Grammy award.... BTS will probably lose every time. That’s the reality. It doesn’t matter how many Twitter interactions and YouTube views they get, it doesn’t even matter how many albums they sell. The Grammys are not solely based on sales and popularity. I think it would be a really cool feat if a non English speaking artist could grab a nomination or even a win, because America and Canada are both quite multicultural, but it will probably take some more time. The Grammys are ultimately decided by the Academy voting members, other musicians, other professionals in the industry, etc. I don’t know what the right answer is as to why BTS didn’t get any nominations. I do think BTS has Grammy worthy music, but I don’t think the music they released this year was it. Just my opinion of course, it doesn’t mean the music wasn’t good. And if I’m honest, a lot of the main categories have music nominated that I wouldn’t call Grammy worthy either. Album of the Year: For example, Vampire Weekend is nominated for Album of the Year for Father of the Bride. If you compare that album to Map of the Soul Persona, it looks a litttttle different. As in, Ezra Koenig (lead vocalist and guitarist of Vampire Weekend) is an executive producer on the album, co-wrote every song on the album and produced all but 2 songs on the album. He’s also the only credited songwriter on 7 of the albums songs. Lana Del Rey is nominated for Album of the Year for Norman Fucking Rockwell, and she’s credited as a writer and producer (excluding track 10) on every single song except Doin Time as that was a remake of Sublime. BTS had multiple producers and writers for their album, they’re also not credited as producers on any of the songs. Map of the Soul also only has 7 tracks while Norman Rockwell has 14 and Father of the Bride has 18 plus bonus tracks. BTS is impressive in the Kpop world, but straight across comparing their album, it doesn’t match up to these guys, and Bon Iver’s album which I didn’t mention in detail but is also more impressive.   The middle column is listed writers on the song and the far right column is listed producers. Here is Lana Del Rey’s album for comparison (I left out her remake of Doin Time which is track 5 because it was.. a remake)   As you can see, Boy With Luv had more writers on that single track than Lana Del Rey had on her entire album. All other nominees including Lizzo, Billie Eilish, Ariana Grande, and HER, (except Lil Nas X, sorry) have impressive track lists with each artist credited as a writer on almost all tracks and a few credited as producing tracks and/or the album. This is where BTS fans struggle in comparing them to Western artists. It’s pretty common to have artists here write and produce their own music. It’s almost laughable when a musician doesn’t play a hand in that actually. BTS is good at writing and composition compared to other current Kpop groups, because that’s not really the norm in Kpop. But in the west, it is, and these artists are much more impressive than BTS in that regard. I chose to dissect this category because Album of the Year is an important one to many artists. The only artist I would maybe argue doesn’t belong here is Lil Nas X. He’s fun and his album was actually pretty good for a new guy, but he doesn’t stand a chance against the other nominees in my opinion. Don’t get mad at me fans of BTS, but if you want them to be winning major awards against huge Western artists then they better bring their best. And I don’t think they did this time. That’s all. I also couldn’t live with BTS getting nominated and losing, then the fans rioting because they lost (think Beyoncé vs Beck a few years ago. Her fans lost their shit, but sorry Beck’s album was much more impressive and well done than Beyoncé’s...) The Grammys invited BTS, interviewed them, all that, and made it seem as though they had a shot.. but this is the same academy that invited Mac Miller’s family to the Grammys only to snub his posthumous ‘Swimming’ album and give the win to Cardi B... which was a terrible choice if you ask me. There’s always going to be more opportunities and BTS has already accomplished so much. They don’t need to win everything. They’ve done lots to be proud of.

I’m not too surprised that BTS weren’t nominated but I do think they could’ve gotten at least something. And to be quite honest, Persona was not their best work at all. If anything, Tear was robbed because that album was really good and one of the best out of LY era. My top two favorite albums along with Wings. BWL was a corny ass, Disney filled song that was too safe and didn’t show their potential. Sure, you can say the same thing about the artists that were nominated but at least some of them have contributed to their music and made an impact. Yes, BTS does have sales popularity but musically, they haven’t made an impact. Folks can clown Lil Nas X all day but even OTW made an impact and created a conversation. Another thing, you can write your own music and it still be trash. Sorry but I never saw the hype for Taylor Swift at all. She can write all day but I will never see her as more talented than Adele, and she’s not my favorite either, or Beyoncé. Had to put that there because people think because you write own music makes you more talented and that’s not always the case. It just shows that ARMYs do care about western validation as much as they claim they don’t. Look at the outrage over the PCA loss and the VMAS. Deep down, you care because if you didn’t, you wouldn’t be this outrage over a Grammy. There are plenty of artists, primarily black artists, who stays getting snubbed no matter how hard they work. Beyoncé can write a whole damn album if she wanted to and will never get an AOTY. Sad but true. ARMYs want to complain about racism and xenophobia when it’s convenient for them but when artists who aren’t white don’t win or are nominated, they don’t give a damn! So please, stop acting like you care about diversity when you don’t at all. Plus, most of y’all are racist as hell when it comes to black artists. Hell black people in general. While it does suck that BTS didn’t get anything, maybe this serves as a wake up for them to bring it music wise because they are a good group and I enjoy them but BH needs to let them have more control on their music and stop trying to please a certain group of people. Don’t lose what made BTS great in the first place. There’s more I want to say but I’m tired right now. All in all, ARMYs need to calm down. Seriously, it’s not the end of the world.
